title: Thunderbird 15 builds unable to select multiple folders
content: Build 115.4.2 (Windows x64 version) installed today and I found I was no longer able to select multiple folders in the left folder view to perform actions on. Neither CTL-click or SHIFT-click works. I tried rolling back to 115.4.1 and 115.3.3 but had the same problem. I finally reverted to pre-Supernova 102.15.1 and that fixed the problem. Any idea what the issue is with this operation in the newer builds?
creator: chris317

title: How Can I install the version previous to 115?
content: I am not a fan of the constant evolution of software (see below). Vers. 115 requires me to spend time and effort to re-learn software I had already pretty much mastered. I see no improvements I wanted and can use none of those I was provided efficiently. I wish to backdate my version of Thunderbird and lock that version in place. How can I do those two things?
creator: Larrydeb

title: Suddenly outgoing email stopped working
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for many years with no problem. I'm now on v. 115.4.2 (64-bit). Suddenly, I can no longer send email. This is the message I get:

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: <sy777@maine.rr.com> sender rejected. The email address you are sending as must match the email address you used to auth. Please check your SMTP settings. AUP#Out-1500. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again.

I contacted Spectrum and received their recommended settings. The only difference I have is that my Authentication is set to NONE and theirs to YES OR CHECKED

My incoming email works fine.

Please help!
creator: sy777

title: Thunderbird not syncing to IMAP server
content:
I often move emails in Thunderbird to various folders. However this movement is not reflected in the IMAP server unless I repair the .msf file multiple times.

Is there a way to achieve a permanent fix?

Thanks!
creator: vikram.vijayan

title: Missing 'On My Computer' Calendars
content: I've just upgraded from TB 91 to TB 115 and unfortunately all my 'local' calendars are missing and I cannot add them back either. By local I mean 'On My Computer'. There is no problem with my 'On The Network' calendars, both existing and new ones can be added. But when I click New Calendar > On My Computer > (fill in name) > Create Calendar... nothing happens... no new calendar appears.
creator: mark514

title: Recovery of my thunderbird account
content: The day about one month ago my account in Thunderbird stopped. Since the day my account of Thunderbird has never worked. My desktop pc is supported with Widows11. On the other hand another Thunderbird in my notebook pc continues to work. This Thunderbird is run by Tb of version 112, but Tb in the desktop pc by 115. I asked to help recover my account in desktop pc to my email Japanese provider, plala.or.jp. They has failed to recover the account. then they has given me "plala web mail" . Then I continue to enjoy email with "plala web mail" and Thunderbird account in notebook pc. But I want Thunderbird account in my desktop pc. I would like to ask you to help me in recovering Thunderbird account in desktop pc. Thnk you!
creator: sakishita9
